input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is IBMTSMActor

FIND NODE DETAILS:
This wrapper displays information about one or more nodes.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>find-node-details</operation-name> <timeout-secs>30</timeout-secs> <command-options> <node-name>*</node-name> <domain>standard</domain> <format>detailed</format> <type>client</type> </command-options> </item> </items>
Elements Description:
operation-name [Required]: the operation name. Valid values: find-node-details.
timeout-secs [optional]: the time out second. the unit of this parameter is "second". Valid value: any integer greater than 0; Default value: 60.
command-options [Required]: within this element we provide the informations (elements) such as <node-name>, <domain-name> etc.
node-name [Optional]: The node name we are looking for.
Valid values: The targeted node-name, or we can use wildcard character "*". Default value: This tag is ignored to be matched while retrieving a node.
domain [Optional]: Specifies the name of the policy domain to which the node belongs.
Valid values: The domain name of targeted node, or we can use wildcard character "*". Default value: This tag is ignored to be matched while retrieving the nodes.
format [Optional]: Specifies how to display the information.
Valid values: Standard, Detailed.
Standard Specifies that partial information is displayed for a node. Detailed Specifies that detailed information is displayed for a node.
Default value: Standard.
type [Optional]: Specifies the type of the node.
Valid values: Client, NAS, Server, Any. Default value: Client.

documentation.description: This wrapper displays informations about one or more nodes.
